attributes.action: Make it compulsory for fixed term airline staff to receive ongoing furlough
attributes.additional_details: As a fixed term cabin crew member I am coming to the end of my contract on 8/11/20. However another lockdown has been introduced and furlough extended. However I, along with many colleagues, am not entitled to this according to the airline I work for. Thousands of staff will be entering a saturated job market making it very hard to get a new role/temporary role which would ordinarily be there. This leads to even more mass unemployment and mental health worry.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for airlines to have to provide airline staff that have been on a fixed term contract when another lockdown was announced with furlough.

rejection.details: Decisions about contracts and whether or not to retain staff is one for individual employers, not the UK Government or Parliament. You could start a new petition asking for the UK Government to provide financial support for staff whose temporary contracts have ended, if that's something that you'd like to see.
